ch.bfh.btx8081.w2015.red.Schlurp.mediplan

Class MedicamentList

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.bfh.btx8081.w2015.red.Schlurp.mediplan.MedicamentList

  • public class MedicamentList
extends java.lang.Object
    The class represents an MedicamentList witch consists of an ArrayList filled with Medicaments.

    Methods for reading and writing from/to a text file and one for checking if a certain Medicament already exists in the ArrayList are provided.

    Author:
    Rea Iseli

    • Constructor Detail

      • MedicamentList

    • Method Detail

      • readInformationsFromMediplan

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Medicament> readInformationsFromMediplan(java.lang.String inputFileName)
        Reads the content of a text file with the name of the variable inputFileName. Each line represents a Medicament and its values are separated with the delimiter defined in the Method. It stores the read data in an ArrayList object.
        Parameters:
        inputFileName - the name of the file that will be read
        Returns:
        the ArrayList: newMediList

      • writeMediToMediplan

        public static void writeMediToMediplan(java.util.ArrayList<Medicament> medi,
                                       java.lang.String outputfileName)
        Writes the data of the MedicamentList to a defined Textfile
        Parameters:
        medi - an ArrayList filled with Medicaments
        outputfileName - the name of the file which will be overwritten

      • exists

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Medicament> exists(Medicament medi,
                                                     java.util.ArrayList<Medicament> mediList)
        Tests if the Medicament medi already exists in the ArrayList mediList. The test is based on the name of the Medicament and if it already exists, this Medicament is removed from the ArrayList so that it can be added with the new content
        Parameters:
        medi - the Medicament to test if it exists
        mediList - the MedicamentList with the recent Medicaments of the Patient
        Returns:
        modified ArrayList newMediList

      • removeMedicament

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Medicament> removeMedicament(java.lang.String mediName,
                                                               java.util.ArrayList<Medicament> mediList)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
